“Creativity is intelligence having fun.” – Albert Einstein
"every artist was first an amateur" - ralph waldo emerson
“When inspiration doesn’t come, I go halfway to meet it.” ~Freud
"Making money is art & working is art & good business is the best art." -Warhol

paragraphs.text: So. Listen. If you’re here and you’re reading and you want to, here’s a way to support the writers that make this community special.
paragraphs.name: a9e6

paragraphs.text: Set up a PayPal account. Figure out how to link it to your stories (I’m working on it), and do so. I know, I know — I have thought about this and felt (and still feel) uncomfortable doing it. I don’t know if what I have to offer is good enough to ask for compensation, and I know that most of the folks who are good enough to read my writing don’t have money to toss around. But I’ll tell you this, fellow writers: I value your words. So many of you have written the exact words I needed on a bad day, or given me inspiration on an uninspired one, or made me laugh on a joyless one. I know the green heart means the world, but if I could buy you a cup of coffee or a beer or the extra guacamole on your burrito, I would love to — even if it’s just once.
paragraphs.name: b46a

paragraphs.text: And yet, Medium seems intent on rewarding those who create content that can be found, let’s face it, anywhere else on the internet. There are plenty of sites where you can find listicles and pseudo-inspirational crap for those days when you feel like you need a kick in the ass. I don’t know about you, but that’s not why I come here. The pieces that I’ve read and have haunted or inspired me have not been the ones that promise 37 Ways to Be More Productive Before 3:27 AM or 15 Ways to Make Your Asshole Smell Like Fine Wine — they have been heartfelt, heart wrenching, authentic pieces that were raw, unique, and relatable.
paragraphs.name: 0d41

8cbb36dae054.title: It’s kind of sad to have to scroll through something like 20 pages to find something worth reading.

paragraphs.text: It’s kind of sad to have to scroll through something like 20 pages to find something worth reading. It would be really normal if I just didn’t like the subject or writing style, but most of the things that pop up on my feed are things that I can’t even begin to try describing n any other way than the way you did.
paragraphs.name: 47fd

virtuals.subtitle: So yeah, that gets me a little sad everyday.

content.subtitle: So yeah, that gets me a little sad everyday.

d00a322195ac.title: All these writers trying to get money from other writers and it is really hard to do, would 100…

paragraphs.text: All these writers trying to get money from other writers and it is really hard to do, would 100 writers write for a cause that guaranteed a way to obtain a basic income for all? We are moving into an era when everyone will be in the Writer’s Dilemma and will have to recreate our societies ….
paragraphs.name: 8b7e

c725427d62b2.title: Trust me, this is incredibly uncomfortable for me.

paragraphs.text: Trust me, this is incredibly uncomfortable for me. It came about, in part, while talking to my mom. I kind of passed the idea by her and instead of going off about how asking for money isn’t ok (which is what I thought she’d say), instead she got really serious and said, “Why don’t you value your work? It’s part of you, and people take a piece of it…

50c79a113e74.title: Ha! She’s kind of awesome, right?

paragraphs.text: Ha! She’s kind of awesome, right? Whenever I convince myself she’s going to approach something in a particular way she goes hard left and surprises the hell out of me, saying the thing I needed to hear but never thought she’d say.
I’m sayin’, it takes three seconds and doesn’t cost you anything. Your words are worth it. =)
